title.native: 東のエデン 劇場版II Paradise Lost
title.romaji: Higashi no Eden Movie II: Paradise Lost
title.english: Eden of the East the Movie II: Paradise Lost

description:
The story of political and subversive intrigue in the series finally reaches endgame. Even as the law enforcement net tightens around Saki and her fellow Eden of the East associates over alleged terrorist activities, the complex web surrounding the mysterious Mr. Outside is finally untangled as the remaining Selecao attempt to outmaneuver one another. Takizawa's memories and identity are also finally revealed including his association with a former Prime Minister and his request to be the King of Eden.

(Source: Anime News Network)
synonyms: Higashi no Eden: Gekijouban II Paradise Lost

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Police
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of law enforcement officers.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Battle Royale
tags.description: Centers around a fierce group competition, often violent and with only one winner.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

tags.name: Terrorism
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a terrorist or terrorist organization.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

title.native: 東のエデン 劇場版I The King of Eden

name.native: ミスター・アウトサイド

node.description: __Mike McFarland__ is an American voice actor, ADR Director, Script, and Line Producer at Funimation Entertainment.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/chicaumino) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/chicaumino)

Chica Umino is the pen name of​ an anonymous Japanese female mangaka, designer, and illustrator. She graduated from the Tokyo Metropolitan Art and Craft High School. Her pen name comes from her favorite location Umi no Chikaku no Yuuenchi (海の近くの遊園地, lit. an amusement park by the sea), which is also the title of her doujinshi works prior to her debut. She likes Harry Potter and anime by Hayao Miyazaki. She calls herself an otaku.    

Umino still keeps contact with Hiroshi Kamiya and Mikako Takahashi, who voice Takemoto and Yamada, respectively from the anime adaptation of Honey and Clover.

[Website](http://www.kenjikawai.com/index_e.html) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%B7%9D%E4%BA%95%E6%86%B2%E6%AC%A1)

After dropping out of a nuclear engineering program at Tokai University, Kawai Kenji began studying music at Shobi Music Academy. However, he dropped out after half a year. With a few friends, he created the band Muse, playing fusion rock and participating in music competitions. Through competing in such contests, the band members became technically competent to enter the music industry and decided to part ways.

After leaving Muse, Kawai Kenji began composing music for commercials in his home studio. While recording music for [Yuji Mitsuya](https://anilist.co/staff/95874/) he met music director Naoko Asari, who advised him to compose anime soundtracks. Some of his most famous anime soundtracks can be found in [Patlabor](https://anilist.co/anime/1288/), [Ranma ½](https://anilist.co/anime/210/), [Ghost in the Shell](https://anilist.co/anime/43/), [Fate/Stay Night](https://anilist.co/anime/356/), [When They Cry](https://anilist.co/anime/934/) and more recently in [Mob Psycho 100](https://anilist.co/anime/21507/).

He has worked on several projects with the director [Mamoru Oshii](https://anilist.co/staff/99097/) and has written scores for all of Hideo Nakata's films. Kenji Kawai's music has received the Annie award and Hong Kong Film Award in 2005, for [Ghost in The Shell 2: Innocence](https://anilist.co/anime/468/) he was nominated for an Annie award.

Following his success as an anime music composer, he became involved in live action movies. He contributed music to horror films: Ring, Ring 2, Dark Water, Japanese-Polish science-fiction film Avalon and the Hong Kong film Seven Swords.

For the music found in Seven Swords and A Battle of Wits he was nominated for Best Original Film Score Awards at both the 25th and 26th Hong Kong Film Awards in 2006 and 2007.

(Source: AniDB)

The founder and former representative director of [Funimation](https://anilist.co/studio/102/).

**Non-anime roles:**
- Policeman in "Chuck E. Cheese in the Galaxy 5000"
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/bang20140617)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kixyuubann) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/神山健治)

He has worked regularly with the anime studio and production enterprise, Production I.G, such as his work on [Jin-Roh](https://anilist.co/anime/570/), Patlabor, [Blood: The Last Vampire](https://anilist.co/anime/405/), and for whom he has directed the [Ghost in the Shell: Stand Alone Complex](https://anilist.co/anime/467/) anime series. In 2002 he made his directorial debut with [MiniPato](https://anilist.co/anime/2733/).

In 2007, he directed the TV series [Guardian of the Sacred Spirit](https://anilist.co/anime/1827/) and [Eden of the East](https://anilist.co/anime/5630/).

Started his career as a background artist.

(Source: Wikipedia)

name.native: スクール フード パニッシュメント

node.description: Introduction: School Food Punishment was a Japanese four-piece rock/pop/electronica band. They were first signed under record label July Records/United Asia Entertainment (2007-2007), then under Fiveman Army Rocks (2008-2009) and then finally signed under Sony Music Japan's Epic Records Japan prior to their breakup in June 2012. The lyrics of each of the band's songs from 2004-2012 were written by lead vocalist and guitarist Yumi Uchimura. Biography: The band was founded on October 2004 by [Uchimura Yumi](https://anilist.co/staff/152896/), while their first live performance took place in December the same year. In 2007, their debut album, "school food is good food", was released. In 2008, both of their songs, "feedback" and "Futari Umi no Soko" were featured as theme songs to the Japanese television drama Joshidaisei Kaikeishi no Jikenbo, while their mini-album "Riff-rain" was released by Tower Records and sold out in under a week. They also performed in numerous live concerts, including FM802, part of the Minami Wheel 2008 live event, and the J-Wave Live event, part of the Tokyo Real Eyes Live Supernova. In 2009, they signed onto their first major record label, Sony Music Japan's Epic Records Japan division. Their major label debut was the song "futuristic imagination", which was used as the ending theme song to the Kenji Kamiyama directed anime television series Eden of the East, airing on the highly rated noitaminA timeslot on Fuji TV. Among their first projects, was contributing to Judy and Mary's 15th Anniversary Tribute Album, in which they covered the band's "Brand New Wave Upper Ground" song, with their performance praised by sources such as The Japan Times for having been the highlight of the album, and for having evoked Judy and Mary's songwriting and musical values. In 2012, the band announced that it would be going on an indefinite hiatus. The band said the decision came as a result of discussions between the four members. On June 11, 2012 the band announced that they had broken up due to vocalist [Uchimura Yumi](https://anilist.co/staff/152896/) having left the band. Following the disbandment of the band School Food Punishment, [Uchimura Yumi](https://anilist.co/staff/152896/), producer [Eguchi Ryo](https://anilist.co/staff/109383/) and touring guitarist Mitsui Ritsuo joined the band la la larks known as the successor to the band School Food Punishment. In 2016, Hasuo Masayuki and Yamasaki Hideaki found a new singer named Annabel, and formed their own band siraph, as well. Final Members: - [Uchimura Yumi](https://anilist.co/staff/152896/) (内村友美) – founder, lead-vocalist, guiarist and songwriter (2004-2012) - Hasuo Masayuki (蓮尾理之) – keyboardist, organist, electric pianoist and composer (2004-2012) - Hideaki Yamasaki (山崎英明) – bass guitarist, backing vocalist and composer (2008-2012) - Hidai Osamu (比田井修) – drummer and composer (2007-2012) Former Members: - Ueda Atsushi (上田睦) – bass guitarist (2004-2008) - Katano Katsuya (片野勝哉) – drummer (2004-2007) (Source: en.wikipedia.org)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/石川光久)

Co-founder and representative director of [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/). The studio is named after him and [Takayuki Gotou](https://anilist.co/staff/103266/).

Ishikawa acted as executive producer for the anime sequence The Origin of Ren in Kill Bill, and was the producer of the first two [Ghost in the Shell](https://anilist.co/anime/43/) films. In 2005, Ishikawa joined his first joint Japanese-U.S. collaboration, since the opening of the Production I.G branch in Los Angeles, IGPX: Immortal Grand Prix, a joint production with Production I.G and Cartoon Network. Ishikawa has also produced Batman: Gotham Knight, Halo Legends and Dante's Inferno: An Animated Epic.

He also served as an executive at Bee Train from 1997 to 2006.

(Source: Wikipedia)

Stared his career at [Studio Live](https://anilist.co/studio/6460/Studio-Live). One of the founding members of [P.A. Works](https://anilist.co/studio/132/PA-Works), he is currently Head of the Animation Department at the studio. He became close with [Kenji Kamiyama](https://anilist.co/staff/100348/Kenji-Kamiyama) while working on The Hakkenden, with the two working together on [Ghost in the Shell: Stand Alone Complex](https://anilist.co/anime/467/Ghost-in-the-Shell-Stand-Alone-Complex/) where Yoshihara directed the episodes outsourced to P.A. Twitter __Ryou Eguchi__ is a Japanese producer, composer and arranger. He was the producer of the Japanese rock-band School Food Punishment between 2008 until 2012 when the band officially disbanded. He later joined la la larks, with previous members from the band School Food Punishment as their producer.

Twitter __Ryou Eguchi__ is a Japanese producer, composer and arranger. He was the producer of the Japanese rock-band School Food Punishment between 2008 until 2012 when the band officially disbanded. He later joined la la larks, with previous members from the band School Food Punishment as their producer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/asakonishida) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/24387) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/西田亜沙子)

Originating from Studio Muu.


Married to fellow animator [Seiichi Nakatani](https://anilist.co/staff/107409/Seiichi-Nakatani).
**Shoutarou Suga** was a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/竹内敦志)

Affiliated with [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/). Takeuchi is a renown mechanical designer and anime director, having worked on such high profile projects as [The Sky Crawlers](https://anilist.co/anime/3089/) and [Ghost in the Shell](Ghost in the Shell).

He also took part in the production of Star Wars: The Clone Wars.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1522114648098619397)

He grew up admiring anime such as [Space Battleship Yamato](https://anilist.co/anime/1650/) an during highschool he started animating with his friends. He enrolled into a professional animation school after graduating but quit quickly due to being disappointed in how the lessons were conducted.

He joined Anime R and later its subsidiary Studio Muu. His first work was as an in-betweener on [Psycho Armor Govarian](https://anilist.co/anime/6428/) while his debut as a key animator was on [Captain Tsubasa](https://anilist.co/anime/2116/).

After working on [Mamoru Oshii](https://anilist.co/staff/99097/)'s [Patlabor](https://anilist.co/anime/1095/) he permanently joined Production I.G. becoming known, together with [Hiroyuki Okiura](https://anilist.co/staff/103502/) and [Tetsuya Nishio](https://anilist.co/staff/103725/), as "The Three Gods of I.G."

He's is one of the most prominent animators of the realist school, with emphasis on solid shapes and weighty character animation.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1522114648098619397)

He's is one of the most prominent animators of the realist school, with emphasis on solid shapes and weighty character animation.
